question: Question: Which entities (Disorder, Patient, H-Professional) are present in this text?

question: Question: Which entities (Disorder, Patient, H-Professional) are present in this text?
text: Text: "El paciente se mantuvo asintomático hasta marzo de 2007 cuando acudió a nuestro hospital por un cuadro de astenia, inestabilidad y dolor abdominal seguido de hematemesis masiva con afectación clínica y hematológica (Hb 7,1g, hematocrito 21,5%)."
translation: English translation of the text: "The patient remained asymptomatic until March 2007 when he came to our hospital with symptoms of asthenia, instability, and abdominal pain followed by massive hematemesis with clinical and hematological involvement (Hb 7.1g, hematocrit 21.5%)."

question: Question: Which entities (Disorder, Patient, H-Professional) are present in this text?
text: Text: "Con el diagnóstico de neoformación renal estadio T3bN0M0 con trombo tumoral nivel II, se decide intervenir, conjuntamente con el servicio de cirugía cardiaca de nuestro centro, realizando esternotomía y laparotomía subcostal izquierda y, previa liberación del ángulo esplénico del colon mediante apertura del retroperitoneo a nivel del mesenterio, nefrectomía radical izquierda permaneciendo la pieza de nefrectomía anclada por la vena renal trombosada."
answer: Answer: "{'Disorder': ['neoformación renal', 'trombo tumoral', 'la vena renal trombosada'], 'Patient': [], 'H-Professional': ['el servicio de cirugía']}"
translation: English translation of the text: "With a diagnosis of renal neoplasm stage T3bN0M0 with a level II tumor thrombus, it was decided to perform surgery, in conjunction with the cardiac surgery department of our center, performing a sternotomy and left subcostal laparotomy and, after freeing the splenic flexure of the colon by opening the retroperitoneum at the level of the mesentery, a left radical nephrectomy was performed, with the nephrectomy specimen remaining anchored by the thrombosed renal vein."

question: Question: Which entities (Disorder, Patient, H-Professional) are present in this text?
text: Text: "Remitido a oftalmología a los 40 días, para estudio de fondo de ojo, presentaba la siguiente exploración oftalmológica: la agudeza visual (AV) era de 0,8 en ambos ojos, la presión intraocular (PIO) de 13 mm de Hg y en el fondo de ojo derecho (OD) se observó una microhemorragia por encima de papila y cuatro émbolos de colesterol y en el fondo del ojo izquierdo (OI) otros dos émbolos localizados en rama temporal y nasal."
translation: English translation of the text: "Referred to ophthalmology 40 days later for a fundus examination, the following ophthalmological examination was performed: visual acuity (VA) was 0.8 in both eyes, intraocular pressure (IOP) was 13 mm Hg, and in the right eye fundus (OD) a microhemorrhage was observed above the optic disc and four cholesterol emboli, and in the left eye fundus (OS) two other emboli were located in the temporal and nasal branches."

question: Question: Which entities (Disorder, Patient, H-Professional) are present in this text?
text: Text: "Mujer de 51 años de edad, con antecedentes de anexectomía unilateral por endometriosis, que tras 24 horas de evolución presenta fiebre de hasta 40 oC y odinofagia, remitiendo dicha sintomatología parcialmente con antiinflamatorios no esteroideos (AINE)."
translation: English translation of the text: "A 51-year-old woman with a history of unilateral adnexectomy due to endometriosis, who after 24 hours developed a fever of up to 40°C and odynophagia, with partial remission of these symptoms with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)."

question: Question: Which entities (Disorder, Patient, H-Professional) are present in this text?
text: Text: "El cuadro fue interpretado como de origen vascular, bien posicional, o bien derivado de los antecedentes migrañosos de la paciente, siendo sometida empíricamente a tratamiento con dexametasona y vasodilatadores."
translation: English translation of the text: "The condition was interpreted as being of vascular origin, either positional or related to the patient's history of migraines, and she was empirically treated with dexamethasone and vasodilators."
